title: France’s Total Takes $4.1 Billion Charge Related to Russia Sanctions
sub_head: The energy giant said Western sanctions would affect an Arctic natural-gas project that had been expected to launch next year
body:
French energy giant TotalEnergies SE said Wednesday it has taken a $4.1 billion accounting charge on the value of its natural-gas reserves, citing impacts from the Western sanctions targeting Russia.
Total’s write-down was tied to a massive Arctic liquefied natural gas project under development called Arctic LNG 2, making it the latest major oil company to document the financial repercussions of doing business with Russia following the country’s attack on Ukraine.
